# UTTagClass

**Structure**

A type that represents tag classes.

## Declaration

```swift
struct UTTagClass
```

## Overview

A tag class is a label that represents the mapping of a [doc://com.apple.uniformtypeidentifiers/documentation/UniformTypeIdentifiers/UTType-swift.struct] to another type system; for example, a MIME type or a file system extension.

A tag is a specific instance of a tag class. For example, the tag `txt` is an instance of the tag class [doc://com.apple.uniformtypeidentifiers/documentation/UniformTypeIdentifiers/UTTagClassFilenameExtension] and represents the type [doc://com.apple.uniformtypeidentifiers/documentation/UniformTypeIdentifiers/UTTypePlainText].

[doc://com.apple.uniformtypeidentifiers/documentation/UniformTypeIdentifiers/UTTagClass] uses an untyped `String` or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFString] to refer to a tag class as a string. To get the string representation of a tag class, use its `rawValue-swift.property` property.

## Getting a declared types mapping

- **filenameExtension**: A type property that returns the tag class used to map a type to a filename extension.
- **mimeType**: A type property that returns the tag class used to map a type to a MIME type.

## Uniform type identifiers

- **UTType**: A structure that represents a type of data to load, send, or receive.
- **UTTypeReference**: An object that represents a type of data to load, send, or receive.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
